intro: Croton latsonensis, commonly known as the Philippine croton, is a flowering plant species native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with distinctive floral structures. The plant is characterized by its alternate, ovate leaves that are often bright green with a waxy texture. It produces small, clustered yellow flowers that are followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
